episodeTitle: Protect Kaya! The Usopp Pirates' Great Efforts!
episodeTitleJapanese: カヤを守れ！ウソップ海賊団大活躍！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaya o Mamore! Usoppu Kaizokudan Dai Katsuyaku!
description: In the forest, Jango hunts down Kaya and forces her to sign her will under threat of death. The Usopp Pirates try to defend her but fail. Meanwhile, at the northern coast, Kuro reveals his true nature by unleashing his deadly Shakushi technique, attacking everyone indiscriminately including his own crew.

events.title: Usopp Pirates Escort Kaya Through the Forest
events.description: Piiman, Tamanegi, and Ninjin escort Kaya through the forest, attempting to hide from Jango who is pursuing them. However, Kaya's illness makes it difficult for her to continue running and she begins to slow down.
events.significance: Shows the Usopp Pirates' loyalty to Kaya and their bravery despite being children facing a dangerous enemy.

events.title: Usopp Pirates Attempt to Ambush Jango
events.description: The three children try to ambush Jango with a fake surrender, using their weapons and a falling log trap. However, Jango easily dodges all their attacks and remains completely unharmed, demonstrating the vast difference in power between them.
events.significance: Highlights the children's courage and creativity despite being outmatched, and establishes Jango as a formidable opponent.

events.title: Kaya Agrees to Sign the Will
events.description: After Jango threatens to kill the Usopp Pirates, Kaya decides to sacrifice herself to save them. She agrees to sign the will that would leave her fortune to Klahadore (Kuro) in exchange for sparing the children's lives.
events.significance: Demonstrates Kaya's selflessness and caring nature, willing to give up everything to protect innocent children. This is a key character moment that shows her nobility.

quotes.text: I'll sign it! Just don't hurt them!
quotes.speaker: Kaya
quotes.context: Kaya sacrifices herself to save the Usopp Pirates from Jango

events.title: Zoro and Usopp Arrive to Save Kaya
events.description: Just as Jango is about to kill Kaya after she signs the will, Roronoa Zoro and Usopp finally locate her and arrive in the nick of time. They position themselves between Jango and Kaya to protect her.
events.significance: Classic rescue timing that prevents Kaya's death. Shows Usopp and Zoro's determination to protect Kaya and honor their promise to defend the village.

quotes.text: You're not laying a finger on her!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp confronts Jango to protect Kaya

events.title: Pandaman's Anime Debut Among Black Cat Pirates
events.description: Pandaman, the iconic easter egg character, makes his first appearance in the One Piece anime (excluding the opening theme). He appears as a member of the Black Cat Pirates during the battle at the northern coast.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of Pandaman's tradition of appearing as a background character throughout the entire One Piece series. He becomes one of the series' most enduring easter eggs.

events.title: Kuro Reveals His Plan to Kill His Own Crew
events.description: Captain Kuro reveals his ruthless plan to the Black Cat Pirates: he intends to kill them all as part of his scheme. After obtaining Kaya's fortune, he plans to eliminate all witnesses, including his loyal crew members who have served him for years.
events.significance: Establishes Kuro's cold, calculating nature and complete lack of loyalty or honor. This revelation shows how different he is from other pirate captains who value their crews, setting up a stark contrast with Luffy's leadership philosophy.

quotes.text: I have no need for any of you anymore. You're all just loose ends that need to be tied up.
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro reveals his intention to betray and kill his own crew

events.title: Kuro Unleashes Shakushi Technique
events.description: Kuro demonstrates his ultimate technique, Shakushi (Scoop Death), moving at incredible speed of approximately 100 meters in 4-5 seconds. He attacks everything in his path indiscriminately, slashing at such great speed that he becomes completely invisible to his opponents. The technique hits both Luffy and his own crew members.
events.significance: The debut of Kuro's signature and most dangerous technique. This attack showcases Kuro's incredible speed and power, while also demonstrating his willingness to harm his own crew. It establishes him as one of the fastest enemies Luffy has faced so far.

events.title: Black Cat Pirates Injured by Their Own Captain
events.description: As Kuro uses his Shakushi technique, he indiscriminately slashes everything in his path, severely wounding many of his own crew members. The Black Cat Pirates are left gravely injured and shocked by their captain's betrayal.
events.significance: Demonstrates the fatal weakness of Kuro's Shakushi technique - he cannot control who he attacks. This moment also shows the Black Cat Pirates the true nature of their captain, who cares nothing for their lives.

events.title: Luffy Struggles Against Kuro's Speed
events.description: Luffy attempts to fight back against Kuro's Shakushi technique but struggles to track Kuro's movements due to his incredible speed. The technique's unpredictable nature makes it nearly impossible for Luffy to defend or counterattack effectively.
events.significance: Shows Luffy facing an opponent whose speed surpasses anything he has encountered before, setting up the challenge he must overcome in the upcoming episodes.

events.title: Episode Ends on Dual Cliffhangers
events.description: The episode ends with two ongoing confrontations: Zoro and Usopp facing off against Jango to protect Kaya in the forest, while Luffy continues his difficult battle against Kuro's overwhelming speed at the northern coast.
events.significance: Creates tension and anticipation for the next episode by leaving both major conflicts unresolved.

quotes.text: I'll sign it! Just don't hurt them!
quotes.speaker: Kaya
quotes.context: Kaya agrees to sign the will to save the Usopp Pirates

quotes.text: You're not laying a finger on her!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp arrives to protect Kaya from Jango

quotes.text: I have no need for any of you anymore. You're all just loose ends that need to be tied up.
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro reveals his plan to kill his own crew

themes.description: The episode contrasts true loyalty (the Usopp Pirates risking their lives for Kaya, Usopp and Zoro coming to save her) with ultimate betrayal (Kuro's plan to kill his own crew after years of service).
themes.symbolism: Kuro's Cat Claws slashing his own crew represents the literal cutting of bonds and betrayal of trust.

themes.description: Kaya demonstrates nobility by willing to sacrifice her fortune and life to save the Usopp Pirates, even though they are just children she barely knows.
themes.symbolism: Kaya signing the will represents her willingness to give up everything for others.

themes.description: Kuro's willingness to kill his own crew shows how his ambition for a peaceful, wealthy life has stripped away any humanity or honor he might have once possessed.
themes.symbolism: The Shakushi technique's indiscriminate attacks symbolize how unchecked ambition destroys everything in its path, even allies.

characterSpotlights.development: Kaya shows her selfless nature by agreeing to sign away her fortune to save the Usopp Pirates from Jango. Despite being physically weak and pursued, she demonstrates inner strength and nobility.
keyActions: Flees through the forest with the Usopp Pirates
Agrees to sign the will to save the children
Is rescued by Zoro and Usopp
quotes: I'll sign it! Just don't hurt them!

characterSpotlights.development: Kuro's true nature is fully revealed as he demonstrates his complete lack of loyalty by planning to kill his own crew and using his Shakushi technique that harms friends and foes alike.
keyActions: Reveals plan to kill his own crew
Unleashes Shakushi technique for the first time
Attacks indiscriminately, wounding his own men
quotes: I have no need for any of you anymore. You're all just loose ends that need to be tied up.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp continues to show his growth from coward to hero by arriving to save Kaya and standing up to the dangerous Jango despite the risk.
keyActions: Searches for Kaya in the forest
Arrives just in time to save Kaya from Jango
Stands between Jango and Kaya to protect her
quotes: You're not laying a finger on her!

characterSpotlights.development: The Usopp Pirates show their bravery and loyalty by attempting to protect Kaya despite being outmatched, demonstrating the courage Usopp has inspired in them.
keyActions: Attempts to ambush Jango with traps
Faces death threats to protect Kaya

characterSpotlights.development: Shows courage in the face of danger alongside his friends.
keyActions: Participates in the ambush attempt on Jango
Stands up to Jango despite being threatened

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates loyalty to Kaya and bravery despite being just a child.
keyActions: Helps set up traps to ambush Jango
Refuses to abandon Kaya even when threatened

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the chase scenes and battle sequences, while the manga covers these events more quickly.
Some dialogue and reactions from the Black Cat Pirates when Kuro attacks them are expanded in the anime for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode marks Pandaman's first appearance in the One Piece anime (excluding the opening theme). He appears as a background member of the Black Cat Pirates and would go on to make cameo appearances throughout the entire series.
Kuro's Shakushi technique moves at approximately 100 meters in 4-5 seconds, which is comparable to the speed of CP9's Soru technique that appears much later in the series.
The 4Kids English dub altered some of the dialogue to obscure Jango's suicide threat and downplayed the violence of Kuro's attacks on his own crew.
This episode adapts content from Manga Chapters 38 (pages 2-20) and 39 (pages 2-12).
Kazuki Yao, who voices Jango in Japanese, also voices Bon Clay (Bentham) and Franky later in the series. In 2024, he was replaced by Wataru Takagi due to health issues.

sources.title: One Piece Anime Substitutes Kazuki Yao With Wataru Takagi as Jango's Voice
